sentence1: So she made a fire on her hearth.
sentence2: In order to make it burn better, she put in a handful of straw.

sentence1: In order to make it burn better, she put in a handful of straw.
sentence2: Soon a red-hot coal jumped out of the fire and joined the pair.

sentence1: Soon a red-hot coal jumped out of the fire and joined the pair.
sentence2: The straw began first, and said, "Dear friends, how do you come here?"

sentence1: The straw began first, and said, "Dear friends, how do you come here?"
sentence2: The coal answered, "I jumped out of the fire by great good luck, or I should certainly have met with my death.

sentence1: The coal answered, "I jumped out of the fire by great good luck, or I should certainly have met with my death.
sentence2: I should have been burned to ashes."

sentence1: I should have been burned to ashes."
sentence2: The bean said, "I too have come out of it with a whole skin.

sentence1: The bean said, "I too have come out of it with a whole skin.
sentence2: If the old woman had kept me in the pot I should have been cooked into a soft mass like my comrades."

sentence1: If the old woman had kept me in the pot I should have been cooked into a soft mass like my comrades."
sentence2: "Nor should I have met with a better fate," said the straw.

sentence1: "Nor should I have met with a better fate," said the straw.
sentence2: "The old woman has turned my brothers into fire and smoke, sixty of them she took up at once and deprived of life.

sentence1: "The old woman has turned my brothers into fire and smoke, sixty of them she took up at once and deprived of life.
sentence2: Very luckily I managed to slip through her fingers."

sentence1: Very luckily I managed to slip through her fingers."
sentence2: "I think," answered the bean, "that as we have been so lucky as to escape with our lives, we will join in good fellowship together.

sentence1: "I think," answered the bean, "that as we have been so lucky as to escape with our lives, we will join in good fellowship together.
sentence2: Lest any more bad fortune should happen to us here, we will go abroad into foreign lands."

sentence1: Lest any more bad fortune should happen to us here, we will go abroad into foreign lands."
sentence2: The proposal pleased the two others, and forthwith they started on their travels.

sentence1: The proposal pleased the two others, and forthwith they started on their travels.
sentence2: Soon they came to a little brook, and as there was no stepping-stone, and no bridge, they could not tell how they were to get to the other side.

sentence1: Soon they came to a little brook, and as there was no stepping-stone, and no bridge, they could not tell how they were to get to the other side.
sentence2: The straw was struck with a good idea, and said, "I will lay myself across, so that you can go over me as if I were a bridge!"

sentence1: The straw was struck with a good idea, and said, "I will lay myself across, so that you can go over me as if I were a bridge!"
sentence2: When, however, she reached the middle, and heard the water rushing past beneath her, she was struck with terror, and stopped, and could get no farther.

sentence1: When, however, she reached the middle, and heard the water rushing past beneath her, she was struck with terror, and stopped, and could get no farther.
sentence2: The coal slipped down, hissing as she touched the water, and gave up the ghost.

sentence1: The coal slipped down, hissing as she touched the water, and gave up the ghost.
sentence2: The bean, who had prudently remained behind on the bank, could not help laughing at the sight.

sentence1: The bean, who had prudently remained behind on the bank, could not help laughing at the sight.
sentence2: Not being able to contain herself, she went on laughing so excessively that she burst.

sentence1: Not being able to contain herself, she went on laughing so excessively that she burst.
sentence2: And now would she certainly have been undone for ever, if a tailor on his travels had not by good luck stopped to rest himself by the brook.

sentence1: And now would she certainly have been undone for ever, if a tailor on his travels had not by good luck stopped to rest himself by the brook.
sentence2: As he had a compassionate heart, he took out needle and thread and stitched her together again.

sentence1: As he had a compassionate heart, he took out needle and thread and stitched her together again.
sentence2: The bean thanked him in the most elegant manner, but as he had sewn her up with black stitches, all beans since then have a black seam.
